headline: Kyndryl (NYSE:KD) Misses Q2 Sales Targets, Stock Drops 13%
summary: IT infrastructure services provider Kyndryl (NYSE:KD) fell short of the market’s revenue expectations in Q2 CY2025, with sales flat year on year at $3.74 billion. Next quarter’s revenue guidance of $3.81 billion underwhelmed, coming in 1.5% below analysts’ estimates. Its non-GAAP profit of $0.37 per share was in line with analysts’ consensus estimates.

raw.headline: Kyndryl (NYSE:KD) Misses Q2 Sales Targets, Stock Drops 13%
raw.summary: IT infrastructure services provider Kyndryl (NYSE:KD) fell short of the market’s revenue expectations in Q2 CY2025, with sales flat year on year at $3.74 billion. Next quarter’s revenue guidance of $3.81 billion underwhelmed, coming in 1.5% below analysts’ estimates. Its non-GAAP profit of $0.37 per share was in line with analysts’ consensus estimates.

headline: Kyndryl's first-quarter profit soars as renegotiated contracts aid margins
summary: The company, formerly IBM's infrastructure services business, has been restructuring multiple no-margin contracts it inherited from the Big Blue to generate higher profits, but at the cost of revenue growth.  Kyndryl's net income soared to $56 million for the June quarter from a profit of $11 million in the year-ago-period, while revenue was flat at $3.74 billion.  Businesses have prioritized spending on essential software amid macroeconomic uncertainty spurred by U.S. President Donald Trump's ongoing global trade negotiations.

headline: IBM (IBM) Forms 'Hammer Chart Pattern': Time for Bottom Fishing?
summary: IBM (IBM) witnesses a hammer chart pattern, indicating support found by the stock after losing some value lately. This coupled with an upward trend in earnings estimate revisions could mean a trend reversal for the stock in the near term.

headline: New Charter Technologies Appoints Ryan Davis as Chief Information Security Officer
summary: New Charter Technologies, a portfolio company of Palo Alto-based private equity firm Oval Partners, is pleased to announce the appointment of Ryan Davis as Chief Information Security Officer (CISO). With more than two decades of experience leading and scaling security organizations, Davis brings a proven track record of building resilient, people-centered cybersecurity programs that drive business value.

headline: QuamCore Secures $26M Series A to Build 1-Million-Qubit Quantum Computer in a Single Cryostat
summary: Breakthrough architecture removes quantum scaling limits, reducing size, cost, and complexity for superconducting systemsTEL AVIV, Israel, Aug. 04, 2025 (GLOBE NEWSWIRE) -- QuamCore, a deep-tech startup tackling quantum computing’s hardest scalability challenges, announced a $26 million Series A, bringing total funding to $35 million. headline: Cybersecurity Legends Team Up to Launch Coalfire DivisionHex, Dedicated to Offensive and Defensive Security Services
summary: Coalfire® is introducing its new cybersecurity services and team, DivisionHex™, building on the company's long-time expertise with new specialties in vulnerability management and advanced threat detection. Headed by a team of security stalwarts including former IBM X-Force leaders, DivisionHex identifies weaknesses before adversaries can exploit them.

headline: 97% of AI breach victims lacked access controls, IBM finds
summary: New research shows that AI adoption is outpacing security and governance, with 63% of firms that experienced a breach lacking formal AI governance policies.

raw.headline: 97% of AI breach victims lacked access controls, IBM finds
